metadata.title: The Outback Animal Checklist
metadata.description: The right way to make sure you have the right Australian animals

steps.title: Check that you have a Koala
steps.description:
# Does it look like one?
It is easy to find out.

items.title: Is it a marsupial?
items.caption: Marsupials are obviously mammalian and have a pouch on their underside

items.title: Make sure it eats eucalyptus
items.caption: Almost no other animal can eat eucalyptus leaves, so this is a good diagnostic
items.description: Take some eucalyptus branches, remove some leaves and try to feed the alleged koala

items.title: Does it sleep the whole day?
items.caption: Usually sleeps on trees
items.description: The alleged Koala should sleep the whole day if provided a tree.

items.title: Is it a marsupial?
items.caption: Marsupials are obviously mammalian but possess a pouch on their underside

items.title: Does it have a long tail?
items.caption: Kangaroos use their thick tail as a balance when jumping, and can use it as a support to rear up on when kicking
items.description: Use the meter to measure the tail, it should be pretty long

items.title: Does it jump around?
items.caption: Over very short distances kangaroos will use their forepaws to balance on the ground and swing their legs forward. For longer distance movement, their jumping locomotion is unmistakeable.
items.description: Free the Kangaroo in a field and notice that it will start jumping. Bonus point to use a Trampoline.
